title: Russell Brand vs Nigel Farage on Question Time - as it happened | Politics | The Guardian
summary: john crace on brand v farage .
question time - tonight 's most popular tweets .

documents.title: john crace on brand v farage
text: john crace watched the exchange on question time with keen interest .
you can read his review of the encounter here .

documents.title: summary
text: nigel farage was branded a pound shop enoch powell '' by russell brand .

in one of several heated exchanges during the programme , brand said that bankers in the city , not immigrants , were to blame for the country 's problem , that ukip represented them , and that farage was more sinister than his jovial image implied .
brand said : i sometime feel worried about you , nigel farage .
i know a lot of people are frightened in our country .
i know a lot of people are feeling afraid and frustrated .
and there is a sense that there is a corrupt group in our country , using our resources , taking away our jobs , taking away our housing , not paying taxes , exploiting us .
and they 're is .
there is an economic elite that this man 's party if funded by let me tell you something .
there was an economic crash and a lot of money was lost .
his mates in the city farted ; nigel farage is pointing at immigrants and the disabled and holding his nose .

immigrants are not causing the economic problems and suffering as much as any of us , i enjoy seeing nigel farage in a boozer with a pint and a fag , laughing off his latest scandals about breastfeeding or whatever .
i enjoy it .
but this man is not a a cartoon character .
he ai n't del boy .
he ai n't arther daley .
he 's a pound shop enoch powell and we 've got to watch him .
brand said that he did not want to stand for election because he did not want to become a politician like the others .
he was forced onto the defensive after a member of the audience angrily said he should stand for parliament .
the man told him : you are a campaigner stand .
stand for parliament .
if you are going to campaign , then stand .
do it .
brand replied : my problem would be , mate , i stand for parliament , but i would be scared that i would become one of them .
that 's all from me for tonight .
thanks for the comments .
canterbury prison does not hold any prisoners any more , according to tom mcarthur , and others , on twitter .
tom mcarthur ( @ tommcarthur ) canterbury prison was closed last year .
it quite literally has no prisoners - foreign or otherwise # bbcqt
here are some more clips from the programme .
nigel farage and russell brand on the nhs .
farage on his conduct in the european parliament farage and brand talking about immigration
on his blog guido fawkes has posted the clip of russell brand being criticised by someone in the audience for not standing for parliament .
the telegraph 's michael deacon has filed his sketch of tonight 's question time .
here 's an excerpt .
after this , mr brand was disappointingly subdued .

he did not in the least appear to have ruffled mr farage - although , to be fair , mr farage did have the advantage of experience , having appeared on this programme on a record 743 previous occasions .
one last thought .
if the producers of question time agree with their studio audience that we should get rid of punch and judy politics '' , the first thing they should do is get rid of their studio audience .

documents.title: question time - tonight 's most popular tweets
text: here are some of the most popular tweets tonight with the # bbcqt hashtag .
according to tweetdeck , they have all had at least 200 retweets .
piers morgan ( @ piersmorgan ) this audience is fantastic .
you would n't see this on tv anywhere else in the world .
hilariously british .
# bbcqt jane e.m. callaghan ( @ janeemcallaghan ) canterbury prison holds 300 & is specialised for foreign prisoners .
that it is 'full of foreigners ' is hardly a terrifying prospect ?
# bbcqt jane e.m. callaghan ( @ janeemcallaghan ) canterbury prison holds 300 & is specialised for foreign prisoners .
that it is 'full of foreigners ' is hardly a terrifying prospect ?
# bbcqt pete wishart ( @ petewishart ) when i listen to these types of debates it really hurts that scotland voted to remain part of this .

# immigration # ukipuk # bbcqt john prescott ( @ johnprescott ) all these immigrants coming over here and stimulating our economy by £ 25 billion # bbcqt fleetstreetfox ( @ fleetstreetfox ) kent - 99.8 % british .
0.2 % international migrants .
send 'em home , close the gates , swamped i tells ye .

# bbcqt arthur smith ( @ arfursmith ) britain is overpopulated but only by nigel farage # bbcqt george aylett ( @ georgeaylett ) aneurin bevan , founder of the nhs , on putting patients ( regardless of wealth ) before profit .

# bbcqt clive peedell ( @ cpeedell ) why it matters who provides nhs care # bbcqt question time ( @ bbcquestiontime ) russell brand 's claim that 71 mps stand to gain from further nhs privatisation comes from @ twitterid # bbcqtquestion time ( @ bbcquestiontime ) russell brand : 'education , health , a living wage - these things are all rights , not things that we should be squabbling over ' # bbcqt john prescott ( @ johnprescott ) telling an 11 year-old they 're a failure by the state is no way to treat child .
i know .
it happened to me # bbcqtquestion time ( @ bbcquestiontime ) mary creagh wants to provide qualified teachers and great schools for all .

# bbcqt kate bottley ( @ revkatebottley ) dear # gogglebox we ca n't film this weekend i 've just put my fist through the tv and then kicked my own head in # bbcqt kate bottley ( @ revkatebottley ) dear # gogglebox we ca n't film this weekend i 've just put my fist through the tv and then kicked my own head in # bbcqt

documents.title: snap summary
text: snap summary : not one of david dimbleby 's best .
the debate , certainly in the first half , meandered all over the place and at times the audience were getting so rowdy that it sounded a bit like an edition of the jeremy kyle show .

a proper russell brand v nigel farage one-on-one debate would have been rather thrilling - they have the requisite eloquence and mutual contempt - but we only got a few flashes of combat , and mostly the exchanges were diluted by the other three panelists , who were admirably reluctant to grandstand .
mary creagh and camilla cavendish were particularly sensible , i thought .

brand has huge charisma , and i was impressed by his ability to talk about worker experience , but i 'm no closer than i was 60 minutes ago to understanding why he is seen by some as a political guru .
and farage was well , his usual self .
which means rather effective .

documents.title: question 4 - snap verdict
text: question 4 - snap verdict : they did not really have time to get into that question , and it would have been interesting to hear more from the audience .
nigel farage was the most passionate , but not necessarily the most persuasive .
did he carry the audience ?
i do n't know .
and that 's it .
i 'll post a quick instant verdict , round up some of the best reaction on twitter , and post some news lines .
mary creagh says farage is wrong to say grammar schools were abolished .
they were converted into comprehensive schools .
she went to one and did well .
camilla cavendish says in the past teachers had a higher status than they did now .

documents.title: question 4- grammar schools
text: q : would social mobility improve if we returned to the grammar school system which we have here in kent ?
[ the programme is being recorded in canterbury . ]
russell brand disagrees .
attacking ukip for supporting grammar schools , he says they represent nostaglia politics .
nigel farage strongly supports grammar schools .
the best jobs are now taking by people from public schools because there are not opportunities for people from working class backgrounds .
q : what about the evidence saying grammar schools now only benefit the middle classes ?
that would not be the case if there were a grammar school in every town , he says .

documents.title: question 3 - snap verdict
text: question 3 - snap verdict : brand was good .
i 've suddenly realised ; he may look like a celebrity , but he sounds like a union leader .
he has been talking about workers ' experience more than anyone else on the panel .
and farage did a reasonably good job at sounding as if he really has changed his mind about replacing the nhs with a private insurance system .
if you want to vote on who wins tonight , kent online are running an online poll .
a member of the audience asks why nurses are n't getting a pay rise , when mps are getting 11 % .
mordaunt says , if she is an mp in the next parliament , she wo n't take the pay rise .
penny mordaunt says under labour the private sector ran 5 % of nhs services .
that has just gone up to 6 % .
q : does tory policy amount to privatising the nhs ?
no , says mordaunt .
she says ed miliband spoke recently about weaponising '' the nhs .
dimbleby asks what this means .
she says she is not sure .
russell brand says he has spent some time in america , where people get asked for their credit cards .
he knows from talking to health unions that they have had a 9 % pay cut when services have been privatised .
he admires the nhs .
but he is worried that there are 70-odd members of parliament who would benefit from further health privatisation .
this is another reason why he has lost faith in the parliamentary process .

documents.title: question 3 - health
text: q : what role should the private sector play in the nhs ?
nigel farage says ukip has looked at this carefully .
( this is his way of addressing the revelation that two years ago he was floating the idea of breaking it up . )
pfi deals have been a mistake .
instead of out-sourcing work , we should run it for ourselves , and run it better .
q : so you have dropped the idea of replacing the nhs with a private insurance scheme ?
farage says all parties should have a debate on this .
but ukip will fight the next election saying the nhs should remain free .

documents.title: question 2 - snap verdict
text: question 2 - snap verdict : brand 's strident , anti-banker rhetoric is very distinctive , but at times he sounds like a one-club golfer and he was surprisingly meek , resorting to mate '' appeal , when the audience turned on him .
farage was on home territory here , but did not really take control of the discussion .
creagh and cavendish were both measured and persuasive .
but , again , it was a debate that was messy and unfocused .
a woman in the audience chips in with a brand-ish point .
the amount of money not being paid in tax by the rich is a scandal .
piers morgan likes it too .
piers morgan ( @ piersmorgan ) this audience is fantastic .
you would n't see this on tv anywhere else in the world .
hilariously british .
# bbcqt ( that probably says it all . )
a woman in the audience says there are too many people in the uk .
another audience member shouts at her .
she shouts back , saying she should back off '' and that it 's not about racism .
( it 's starting to sound like a pub brawl . )
boy george likes the show .
boy george ( @ boygeorge ) best @ twitterid ever !
( that would n't be my verdict . )
mary creagh says labour wants to put an end to wage exploitation .
labour probably did let too many immigrants into the country .
farage asks : how can we control immigration when we are in the eu and have open-door immigration .
tim shipman ( @ shippersunbound ) a shame this is all about brand and farage .
camilla cavendish , mary creagh and penny mordaunt are 3 of the most sensible people i know
immigration has always been a problem , he says .
the audience do n't seem to agree .
he talks over them .
he knows where the problem is ; it 's in the city .
come and campaign with me against them , he says .
if , after two years , we do n't make progress , i 'll join you .
( brand likes calling people mate '' , but he does n't seem comfortable receiving such an aggressive response . )
a member of the audience tells brand he is a campaigner .
if he wants to campaign , he should stand for parliament .
brand says he is worried that , if he stands for parliament , he will become one of them .
the man in the audience hits back.brand should stand .
a woman starts accusing farage of being a racist scumbug '' .
( dimbleby - usually the best in the business - is chairing this rather poorly tonight .
he seems to have lost control . )

documents.title: question 2 - immigration
text: q : is britain overcrowded ?
nigel farage says you can say that there is plenty of green space in the uk .
but services are over-crowded .
russell brand says farage represents the views of people in the city , his funders .
immigrants are n't to blame for the country 's problems , he says .
farage is a pound shop enoch powell '' , he says .
farage responds .
he invites the audience to agree with him : is n't britain overcrowded ?
they do n't join in , but brand hits back .
he disagrees .

documents.title: question 1 - snap verdict
text: question 1 - snap verdict : that was a hopelessly shambolic discussion , that rambled all over the place without really defining the question of shedding much light on anything .
russell brand is clearly the most charismatic man on the panel , but camilla cavendish , in her final remarks , made the bravest and most sensible contribution .
cavendish says it is not just politics that causes the problem ; it 's sometimes the media 's fault too .
addressing brand , she says he calls politicians fraudsters .
that is the language of the 1930s .
that is dangerous , she says .
she meets a lot of decent mps who are trying to make a difference .
and they have the courage to make a difference .
natcen ( @ natcen ) russell brand says do n't vote , 57 % of the public disagree : # bbcqt
a member of the audience asks about farage 's campaign in south thanet .
what is he doing for the poor ?
farage says he 's not the wealthy one on this panel .
( that 's a non-too-subtle dig at brand . )
farage says people in the australian parliament use bad language .
what about you in the european parliament , dimbleby asks .
there are real passions in politics , farage says .
camilla cavendish complains mps often pass legislation without reading the bill .
and she despairs of pmqs .
penny mordaunt says , like brand , she admirers firefighters .
then pay them , brand says .
creagh says brand should not talk over a woman .
that is one of the things people object to about politics .
and let me chair it , says david dimbleby .
mordaunt is challenged about her recent joke speech in the commons , where she used the word cock '' six times , i think , as a dare .
if you do n't take parliament seriously , why should we , says brand .
he says he 's the one who 's a comedian .
brand says he is like 70 % of people .
he did not vote at the last election , the european elections , he says .
those were the elections that gave us this geezer '' , farage .
if you want us to vote , give us something to vote for .
he mentions the fire brigade union 's dispute with the government .
they are being asked to work for another five years before they can get their pensions , he says .
nigel farage does agree .
the problem these days is that politics is dominated by people who have spent all their lives in westminster , as advisers .
mary creagh says farage is a career politician .
she is n't .
she did not always intend to go into politics .
farage interrupts .
he spent 20 years in business .
did ed miliband ?
no , he has n't spent six weeks in business .
creagh says this is an example of petty point scoring .
( but it 's too late .
farage has already won this skirmish with her . )
nigel farage

documents.title: question 1 - adversarial politics
text: q : is the petty adversarial nature of politics causing its own demise ?
( good question . )
russell brand goes first .
he assumes the questioner thinks the answer is yes .
and he agrees .
the petty , adversarial nature of politics is causing its decline , he says .
russell brand
at least you ca n't accuse the guardian of over-doing it tonight .
the telegraph live blog has been running since 1pm .
john higgs at usvsth3m.com thinks the fact that nigel farage and russell brand are both on question time means politics has reached peak shit '' .
and here are some tweets from the bbc 's excellent @ twitterid twitter feed.question time ( @ bbcquestiontime ) lots of talk about the # bbcqt panelists today .
here 's russell brand 's thoughts on nigel farage question time ( @ bbcquestiontime ) and nigel farage has had quite a bit to say about russell brand in the past as well : # bbcqt
this is what some of the panelists were saying on twitter earlier today .
russell brand ( @ rustyrockets ) `` question time - will these questions come up ? ''
trews comments edition ( anyone know why he calls himself rusty rockets ? )

mary creagh mp ( @ marycreagh mp ) looking forward to crossing swords with @ twitterid farage & @ twitterid on tonight 's # bbcqt camilla cavendish ( @ camcavendish ) wondering if i 'll get a word in edgeways tonight on @ twitterid with russell brand and nigel farage nigel farage ( @ nigel farage ) i 'm on question time tonight , do n't miss it !
tweet at the hashtag # bbcqt during the programme
just over 15 minutes to go .
here is some reading just to get you in the mood .
the guardian highlights some of nigel farage and russell brand 's best moments from their previous question time appearances .
michael deacon at the telegraph imagines how tonight 's programme will go .
the huffington post suggests five questions that russell brand might want to ask nigel farage .
tim stanley at the telegraph previews tonight 's programme , and says the panto season has arrived early at the bbc .
david dimbleby news perhaps it 's a good job sir robin day is no longer with us .
he would probably be horrified by the idea of nigel farage and russell brand taking over his show .
still , it should lively .
and , as a student of politics , day would have been interested in the way mainstream westminster politicians are increasingly being overshadowed by insurgent populists .
farage , the ukip leader , has built a political career by posing as the scourge of the establishment .
but he 's positively conventional compared to brand , the celebrity bohemian comic-cum-revolutionary .
personally , i 've always been a bit mystified as to why his political views attract so much attention , but he 's got almost 9m followers on twitter , so i 'm probably missing something .
we 'll see tonight .

the other three people on the panel are : penny mordaunt , the conservative communities minister ; mary creagh , the shadow international development secretary ; and camilla cavendish , the times columnist .
i 'll be covering question time in detail , bringing you reaction and analysis , and the best comment on twitter , as well as summing up the news lines at the end .
if you want to follow me on twitter , i 'm on @ twitterid .

bulletin.text: Rolling coverage of tonight's BBC Question Time (#bbcqt), with Russell Brand, Nigel Farage, Penny Mordaunt, Mary Creagh and Camilla Cavendish, with comment and analysis.
